answers.answer: Dear Debbie,The good news is that the majority of heart murmurs in young people are benign.  Less common causes of a murmur in a young healthy person would include left ventricular hypertrophy, atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect and other less common valvular defects.  Nothing about his history suggest any of these to me.  I agree that it is wise to get it checked out but it will probably turn out to be nothing.  If something does turn up then at that point his doctor will probably refer him to a cardiologist.  So don't spend too much time worrying until all the results are in.
